definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

pinyin: Ao4 lin2 pi3 ke4 Yun4 dong4 hui4

definition: May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science

sentences.english: Some 28 percent of adolescents say they are too tired to exercise, due to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 28%的年輕人表示，由於睡眠不足而沒勁兒運動。

sentences.english: Each Olympic Games, is the Greek festival of people .
sentences.chinese: 每一屆奧林匹克運動會，都是全希臘人民的節日。

sentences.english: Can you name three celebrity endorsers who endorse the sports brand?
sentences.chinese: 請閣下舉出三個運動品牌的代言人？

sentences.english: If it is too flat, athletes will flip .
sentences.chinese: 如果太平，運動員將翻轉。

sentences.english: Among them was Zhang Ning, a female badminton player, who impressed me deeply.
sentences.chinese: 但最打動我的是女子羽毛球運動員張寧。

sentences.english: She is also a dynamic and sporty girls.
sentences.chinese: 她也是一位具有活力的運動型女孩。

sentences.english: The pranas are always moving, and the mind is ever-changing as well.
sentences.chinese: 呼吸總是運動的，思想也總是千變萬化。

sentences.english: Professional athletes were fully embraced, finally ending the tradition of amateurism at the games.
sentences.chinese: 專業運動員被完全接受，終於在比賽結束的業餘傳統。

sentences.english: Foreland basins are the key areas for the study of orogeny.
sentences.chinese: 前陸盆地是研究造山運動的關鍵地區之一。

sentences.english: The commercial is part of the government's new campaign against smoking.
sentences.chinese: 商業局是政府反對吸菸運動的一部分。

sentences.english: Volunteer to coach or assistant coach a kids sports team.
sentences.chinese: 志願去做孩子們的運動隊教練，或是教練助理。

sentences.english: Only those sports which are practised on snow or ice are considered as winter sports.
sentences.chinese: 只有雪上和冰上項目才被認爲是冬季體育運動。

sentences.english: The player was sidelined with a sprained ankle.
sentences.chinese: 這運動員因踝部扭傷而退場。

sentences.english: Union was a tool used by the capitalists in their vain attempt to damp down the labour movement.
sentences.chinese: 那個黃色工會是資本家妄圖用來撲滅工人運動的工具。

sentences.english: Southern leaders were pleased with the anti-war movement in the North.
sentences.chinese: 南方領導人很高興地看到北方的反戰運動。

sentences.english: Furthermore, little effort has been devoted to the investigation of the function of fictive motion.
sentences.chinese: 另外，對虛擬運動作用的研究也沒有繼續深化。

definition: to toughen/to temper/to engage in physical exercise/to work out/(fig.) to develop one's skills/to train oneself
to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to persevere with/to persist in/to insist on
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
